title: Paying tribute to the Village of Walden upon the occasion of hosting its Leadership Day, and recognizing this year's honorees
fulltext:
LEGISLATIVE  RESOLUTION paying tribute to the Village of Walden upon the
occasion of hosting its Leadership  Day,  and  recognizing  this  year's
honorees

WHEREAS,  It is the sense of this Legislative Body to recognize that the
quality and character of life in the communities across New  York  State
are reflective of the concerned and dedicated efforts of individuals who
are devoted to the welfare of the community and its citizenry; and
  WHEREAS,  The  Village of Walden, under the luminous leadership of its
Mayor, The Honorable Brian Maher, is committed to enhancing the  quality
of life of its citizens, ensuring a positive business, institutional and
educational climate, and providing all essential services; and
  WHEREAS,  Attendant to such concern, and in full accord with its long-
standing traditions, this Legislative Body is justly proud to pay  trib-
ute to the Village of Walden upon the occasion of establishing its Lead-
ership Day, Thursday, January 13, 2011; and
  WHEREAS,  This  auspicious  day  will include an Awards Ceremony to be
held in the Municipal Building, recognizing  this  year's  honorees  for
their  exceptional  volunteerism and public service; these extraordinary
volunteers include Rachel Zaleski, Deborah Robb, David  Kurtz  and  Gary
Kurtz; and
  WHEREAS, Rachel Zaleski is the proud recipient of the Youth Leadership
Award;  she  has  had  an exemplary impact at both her school as well as
within her community; with an above average work ethic, this young woman
has shown outstanding leadership skills and given much of  her  time  to
volunteer activities; and
  WHEREAS,  Deborah  Robb,  an  individual  who also displays remarkable
volunteerism while exhibiting the  type  of  character  that  makes  the
Village  of Walden residents proud, is presented with the distinct honor
of the Volunteer of the Year Award; and
  WHEREAS, The Sam Phelps Service Award is being bestowed upon David and
Gary Kurtz for having displayed noble character and diligence in  carry-
ing out good deeds while remembering the benevolent spirit and steadfast
volunteerism of Sam Phelps; and
  WHEREAS,  Those who give of their time and energies and serve the best
interests of their communities are  an  asset  beyond  remuneration  and
cannot  be  sufficiently  extolled;  Rachel Zaleski, Deborah Robb, David
Kurtz and Gary Kurtz are four such individuals; and
  WHEREAS, Rare indeed is the impressive dedication shown by individuals
for the benefit of others which  Rachel  Zaleski,  Deborah  Robb,  David
Kurtz and Gary Kurtz have displayed throughout their lives; and
  WHEREAS,  It  is  the  custom  of this Legislative Body that those who
enhance the well-being and vitality of their community and have shown  a
long  and  sustained  commitment to excellence certainly have earned the
recognition and applause of all the citizens of this great Empire State;
now, therefore, be it
  RESOLVED, That this Legislative Body pause in its deliberations to pay
tribute to the Village of Walden upon the occasion of hosting its  Lead-
ership  Day, and to recognize this year's honorees for their exceptional
volunteerism and public service; and be it further
  RESOLVED, That copies of this Resolution, suitably engrossed, be tran-
smitted to The Honorable Brian Maher, and the aforementioned honorees.
